The clearest instruction about how to get started with Indian clubs on the market, guaranteed to leave you feeling great. And it only takes 15 minutes a day. If you work at a desk, you’re going to love this course!

You will learn a simple, structured and proved approach to learn progressively more complex exercises with a single club. We start with simple pendulums in all planes of motion, building up to the signature move of Indian clubs, the full swing or mill.

Thierry from Heroic Sport shows you the progressions he has developed since 2010 to make YOU confident to swing clubs and get a great workout on day 5!

What can Indian clubs do for you?

Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion

Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion

Consists of compound movements in multiple planes

Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise

Assists recovery from intense training

Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)

It is fun and you forget you are training.

The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.

Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ Heroic Sport | An ancient discipline

Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors and wrestlers.

Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.

❂ Ready to learn more?

All our educational material has been tested and structured since 2010, in a way that is easy for anyone to learn from home.

Best regards from Thierry & Ron

course you know you may do with what you have this is what you have now if you have a pala vandal right what i recommend you is to have a bottle filled up with water so a little bottle so you got a kilo a club weighing about a kilo and then try to see if you can have another bottle filled up with sand now if you're using sand a very good idea is to plug some kind of little silicone uh prop at the end so the sand doesn't tip out most importantly it doesn't get into the thread when you're screwing and screwing the handle okay so this is gonna work really well because this bottle here is about three kilos okay so at the end of the club you get a decent weight and leverage that's going to help you to actually feel the swings now some of the exercise we're going to do with two hands on the club like this so it's an advantage if you can screw the two parameters together you've got a longer club which is going to make it again easier for you to understand the mechanics of the swing cool so this is about what you need the other thing is of course a space where you can sort of like lift your arms above behind you without eating anything or anyone okay so just like a clotted free um area for training the daily sessions are about 15 minutes they include a warm-up you know most of the times and then we go straight into the exercises so it's gonna be a really nice and easy built up progressively so we go from very simple stuff to more complex stuff and by the end of day four you should be able to do the full swing which is called by some people the mill so we've got this make it into a little short circuit training session for you to get a feel of how you can string all those exercises together to get an effective and fun training [Music]
